longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 3 months beyond the period of
  intended stay. 
 - Nationals of France are allowed to enter with expired (max.
   5 years) National ID Cards issued 
   
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of France.
  Card must clearly state that holder is a national of country
  issuing the ID and contain photo of holder.
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- All minors who are nationals of New Caledonia are expected
  to hold their own travel document. 
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of New Caledonia will be
  expected to hold their own passport or National ID Card
  (where applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia,
  Cyprus, Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- A visa issued to the parent is also valid for the minor
  provided minor's name is also mentioned in the visa.
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents for their next destination . 
- Extension of stay possible for 
Warning:
- Passports and passport replacing documents issued more than
  10 years prior to date of travel are not accepted.
- These entry regulations apply only to the part of Cyprus
  controlled by the government of Cyprus (i.e. they are not
  applicable at Ercan (ECN) and at Gercitkale (GEC)).
 - For entry regulations applicable at Ercan (ECN), see:
   http://mfa.gov.ct.tr/consular-info/visa-regulations/ 
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry
